23800.name: The Monastery Gates
23800.description:
Crumbling stone gates stand before what was once a grand monastery.
Rusted iron hinges hold the remains of oak doors, now rotted to splinters.
Gargoyle statues flank the entrance, their features worn but still
menacing. A cold wind moans through the ruins, carrying whispers that
almost form words. The road continues to the south.

south.description: The road leads back to the plains.

north.description: A weed-choked path leads to the monastery courtyard.

23801.name: The Monastery Courtyard
23801.description:
A once-beautiful courtyard has fallen to ruin. Cracked flagstones are
thrust apart by gnarled weeds. A dry fountain stands in the center, its
basin filled with dead leaves and brackish water. The monastery buildings
loom on three sides — the chapel to the north, the dormitory to the east,
and the library to the west. An oppressive silence hangs over everything.

south.description: The monastery gates lie to the south.

east.description: The dormitory wing stretches to the east.

west.description: The library wing lies to the west.

23802.name: The Crumbling Chapel
23802.description:
The chapel's vaulted ceiling has partially collapsed, letting shafts of
grey light fall upon rows of rotting pews. The altar at the far end is
cracked but still standing, and faded frescoes of holy scenes peel from
the walls. Despite the decay, a faint warmth lingers here — an echo of
the faith that once filled this place. Undead seem uneasy here.

south.description: The courtyard lies to the south.

north.description: Steps lead up behind the altar.

down.description: Stone stairs descend into the crypt.

east.description: A side passage leads to the vestry.

23803.name: The Bell Tower Base
23803.description:
A narrow spiral staircase winds upward into the bell tower. The walls
are carved with prayers and the names of departed monks. Cobwebs thick
as curtains fill the stairwell, and something moves in the darkness above.
A cold draft whistles down from the belfry.

up.description: The spiral stairs ascend to the belfry.

23804.name: The Vestry
23804.description:
This small room once held the monastery's sacred vestments and ritual
items. Smashed cabinets line the walls, their contents scattered and
defiled. Holy symbols have been inverted and smeared with dark stains.
Whatever corruption took this monastery began — or ended — here.

west.description: The chapel lies to the west.

23805.name: The Belfry
23805.description:
The great bronze bell still hangs in its frame, green with verdigris.
Through the open arches, you can see the surrounding countryside — a
bleak panorama of grey moors and dark forests. The wind howls through
the openings, and the bell occasionally shifts with a low, mournful
tone. Something has nested among the rafters above.

23806.name: The Upper Crypt
23806.description:
Stone sarcophagi line both walls of this underground corridor, each
bearing the carved likeness of the monk interred within. Most lids
are still sealed, but a few have been pushed aside, revealing empty
interiors. The air is frigid and still. Faint scratching sounds come
from inside some of the sealed tombs.

down.description: Deeper stairs lead to the lower crypt.

east.description: A passage leads to the ossuary.

23807.name: The Lower Crypt
23807.description:
The oldest tombs in the monastery lie here, their inscriptions worn to
illegibility. A pervasive wrongness fills the air — the dead here do not
rest easily. Dark stains seep from beneath sealed sarcophagi, and the
temperature has dropped to near freezing. Unholy energy pulses through
the stones. The undead draw strength from this corruption.

up.description: Stairs lead up to the upper crypt.

south.description: A tunnel leads deeper into the catacombs.

23808.name: The Ossuary
23808.description:
The walls, ceiling, and pillars of this chamber are constructed entirely
from human bones, arranged in elaborate patterns. Skulls form arches,
femurs create columns, and ribcages line the ceiling in macabre
decorative rows. Despite the grim materials, the craftsmanship is
undeniable. Something watches from the hollow eye sockets.

west.description: The upper crypt lies to the west.

23809.name: The Catacombs - North
23809.description:
Ancient tunnels stretch in every direction, carved from living rock and
lined with burial niches. Many have been broken open, their occupants
gone. The darkness here is almost tangible, pressing in on your light
source. Unholy whispers echo from every direction, making navigation
treacherous.

north.description: The lower crypt lies to the north.

23810.name: The Dormitory Corridor
23810.description:
A long hallway stretches through the dormitory wing. Doors line both
sides, most hanging from broken hinges. The floorboards creak ominously
underfoot, and cold drafts seep from beneath closed doors. Scratching
sounds and muffled moans drift from the monk's former cells.

west.description: The courtyard lies to the west.

north.description: More cells lie to the north.

east.description: The corridor continues to the refectory.

23811.name: The Monk's Cells
23811.description:
Tiny rooms branch off from this section of corridor, each barely large
enough for a pallet and a prayer desk. Personal effects lie scattered —
rosaries, prayer books, simple wooden cups. In several cells, the pallets
have been torn apart, the straw scattered as if by clawing hands.

east.description: A door leads to the abbot's quarters.

23812.name: The Refectory
23812.description:
Long wooden tables fill this dining hall, still set with tarnished
plates and cups as if the monks simply vanished mid-meal. Food has long
since rotted away, but dark stains remain. The kitchen lies through an
arch to the north, and the smell of something burning — though no fire
is visible — drifts through the room.

west.description: The dormitory corridor lies to the west.

23813.name: The Abbot's Quarters
23813.description:
Considerably larger than the monks' cells, the abbot's quarters still
hold an air of authority. A carved mahogany desk dominates the room,
covered in yellowed manuscripts. A four-poster bed, its curtains in
tatters, stands against one wall. A portrait of the last abbot hangs
above the desk — and its eyes seem to follow you. The room is
surprisingly well-preserved, as if maintained by unseen hands.

west.description: The monk's cells lie to the west.

23814.name: The Library Entrance
23814.description:
Tall double doors, one hanging askew, open into the monastery's famous
library. The smell of old parchment and mildew fills the air. Towering
bookshelves stretch into the gloom, many collapsed under the weight of
centuries. Scattered pages drift across the floor like autumn leaves.

east.description: The courtyard lies to the east.

north.description: A reading alcove lies to the north.

23815.name: The Deep Library
23815.description:
The oldest and most valuable texts were kept in this inner section.
Many shelves are empty — their contents removed or destroyed. But some
tomes remain, chained to their lecterns with iron links. Faint
luminescence emanates from certain books, their pages inscribed with
forgotten prayers and sacred knowledge. This area retains a faint
blessing. Undead recoil from the sacred texts.

east.description: The library entrance lies to the east.

south.description: A locked door leads to the scriptorium.

23816.name: A Reading Alcove
23816.description:
A small alcove with a stone bench and a narrow window — now just a
hole in the wall. A single candle burns on the ledge, though no one
could have lit it. The flame doesn't flicker. On the bench lies an
open book, its pages turning by themselves, though there is no wind.

south.description: The library entrance lies to the south.

23817.name: The Scriptorium
23817.description:
Rows of writing desks fill this room, each equipped with dried-out
inkwells and crumbling quills. Unfinished manuscripts lie on several
desks, the handwriting trailing off mid-sentence. One desk has been
smashed to pieces, and dark scratches gouge the stone floor around it
as if something was dragged away.

north.description: The deep library lies to the north.

23818.name: The Armory
23818.description:
Racks of weapons and armor stands line the walls — the monastery
maintained a small but well-equipped guard. Most equipment has rusted
beyond use, but a few suits of plate armor remain standing in their
alcoves, unnervingly upright. As you watch, one of them shifts slightly
with a metallic groan.

south.description: The dormitory corridor lies to the south.

23819.name: The Meditation Garden
23819.description:
What was once a serene garden of raked gravel and carefully tended
bonsai is now an overgrown tangle. Yet a stone circle in the center
remains clear, and sitting within it brings a faint sense of peace.
The ground here has been consecrated by centuries of prayer, and the
blessing holds despite the corruption elsewhere. Undead will not
willingly enter this place.

south.description: The courtyard lies to the south.

23820.name: The Catacombs - Central Chamber
23820.description:
The tunnels converge on a large underground chamber. A black altar
stands in the center, stained with old blood and surrounded by
scattered bones. Unholy symbols are carved into every surface. This
is where the corruption originated — where the last abbot performed
the ritual that damned the entire monastery. The very air throbs with
dark power. Undead are at their strongest here.

east.description: A passage leads to the ritual chamber.

west.description: A collapsed tunnel opens to the west.

23821.name: The Catacombs - Eastern Passage
23821.description:
Bones spill from broken niches along this narrow passage. The floor is
littered with shattered urns and scattered grave goods. Something has
been systematically breaking open every burial niche, collecting the
remains for some dark purpose.

west.description: The northern catacombs lie to the west.

23822.name: The Ritual Chamber
23822.description:
A perfect circle has been carved into the stone floor, filled with
sigils that still glow with a faint, sickly light. This is where the
Abbot's Ghost holds court, bound to the site of his greatest sin.
Candles of black wax burn with pale flames around the circle's edge.
The walls weep moisture that smells of grave earth and incense.

west.description: The central chamber lies to the west.

23823.name: Collapsed Tunnel
23823.description:
Part of the catacomb ceiling has given way here, creating a sloping
pile of rubble that leads up to the monastery gardens above. Roots
from surface plants dangle through the gap. This could serve as an
escape route — or an ambush point. Fresh scratch marks on the rubble
suggest something uses this passage regularly.

east.description: The central chamber lies to the east.

up.description: Rubble slopes up to the meditation garden.

23824.name: The Reliquary
23824.description:
Behind the altar in the chapel, a hidden door opens into this small
chamber. Glass cases — most shattered — once held sacred relics. A few
remain: a saint's finger bone, a vial of blessed water, a fragment of
holy scripture. The room radiates calm. Even the whispers of the dead
fall silent here.

south.description: The chapel lies to the south.

23800.name: restless monk
23800.long_desc: The translucent shade of a monk shuffles along, muttering prayers.
23800.description: This ghostly figure retains the shape of a robed monk, its features blurred and shifting. It shuffles endlessly through the corridors, repeating prayers from a life long ended. Its eyes are hollow voids of sorrow.

23801.name: restless monk
23801.long_desc: A ghostly monk kneels in prayer, oblivious to the living.
23801.description: Another shade of the monastery's former inhabitants. This one seems more peaceful, kneeling in eternal prayer, but will attack if disturbed.

23802.name: restless monk
23802.long_desc: A wailing monk drifts through the refectory, reaching for a meal it can never eat.
23802.description: This spirit seems trapped in the moment of its death, endlessly reaching for the dining table. Its wails are more sorrowful than threatening.

23803.name: spectral priest
23803.long_desc: A spectral priest floats above the ground, dark energy crackling around its hands.
23803.description: More powerful than the common monk spirits, this priest retains knowledge of the divine — now twisted to dark purpose. Its robes shimmer between priestly white and void black, and it commands unholy magic with devastating effect.

23804.name: spectral priest
23804.long_desc: A spectral priest stands before the defiled vestry, guarding it jealously.
23804.description: This priest spirit guards the site of the monastery's original corruption. Dark energy swirls around it protectively.

23805.name: bone collector
23805.long_desc: A hunched, skeletal figure scurries about, gathering bones into a sack.
23805.description: Neither fully alive nor truly undead, the bone collector is a wretched creature that haunts burial sites. It obsessively gathers bones, adding them to the ossuary walls with disturbing precision. Its own body is a patchwork of stolen skeletal parts.

23806.name: bone collector
23806.long_desc: A bone collector crouches among the burial niches, prying them open.
23806.description: This bone collector works methodically through the catacombs, breaking open niches and sorting the contents. It clutches a femur like a club.

23807.name: possessed armor
23807.long_desc: A suit of plate armor stands motionless — then its visor snaps toward you.
23807.description: This full suit of plate armor moves without any visible occupant. Dark energy animates it, purple light flickering behind the visor. It wields a heavy mace with mechanical precision, its movements jerky but devastatingly powerful.

23808.name: possessed armor
23808.long_desc: A suit of armor lurches forward, swinging a rusted sword.
23808.description: Another animated suit, this one wields a corroded longsword. Dents and scratches cover its surface from encounters with previous intruders. None of them survived.

23809.name: shadow bat
23809.long_desc: A bat made of living shadow swoops silently through the belfry.
23809.description: Not a true bat but a manifestation of the monastery's dark energy, this creature is made of shadow and malice. Its eyes burn red and its bite drains warmth from the living.

23810.name: shadow bat
23810.long_desc: A shadow bat hangs from the rafters, watching with burning eyes.
23810.description: This shadow bat clings to the ceiling, folding its insubstantial wings around itself like a cloak of darkness. It drops silently on unsuspecting prey.

23811.name: catacomb crawler
23811.long_desc: A pale, eyeless creature skitters across the catacomb ceiling.
23811.description: This elongated, insectoid creature has adapted to life in the catacombs. Pale and eyeless, it navigates by vibration and hunts anything that disturbs its domain. Multiple legs end in hooked claws that grip stone effortlessly.

23812.name: The Abbot's Ghost
23812.long_desc: The towering specter of the Abbot hovers above the ritual circle, eyes blazing with unholy fire.
23812.description: Once the spiritual leader of this monastery, the Abbot was corrupted by a forbidden text and performed the ritual that killed every monk within these walls, binding their souls — including his own — to the monastery for eternity. His ghost is immensely powerful, wreathed in dark energy, and consumed by guilt twisted into rage. He wields the very prayers he once used to heal as weapons of destruction. Only by defeating him can the monastery's curse be broken.

special.phase_2_message: The Abbot's Ghost screams in anguish! 'You cannot save them! NONE of us can be saved!' Dark energy explodes outward as the specter's form doubles in size.

23813.name: spectral librarian
23813.long_desc: A ghostly figure drifts between the shelves, reshelvng books with translucent hands.
23813.description: This spirit seems less hostile than others, still performing its duties from life. However, it reacts violently to anyone who disturbs the books.

23800.name: Abbot's Holy Mace
23800.room_desc: A golden mace radiating faint holy light lies here, freed from its spectral wielder.

23801.name: Spectral Robes
23801.room_desc: Shimmering robes that seem to phase in and out of existence lie folded here.

23802.name: Tome of Sacred Knowledge
23802.room_desc: A heavy tome bound in white leather glows softly on a lectern.

23803.name: holy water
23803.room_desc: A small glass vial of clear, glowing water sits here.

special.description: Using holy water in a room temporarily consecrates it for 5 minutes, making undead take 50% more damage and deal 30% less damage in that room.

23804.name: monk's prayer beads
23804.room_desc: A strand of wooden prayer beads lies on the ground.

23805.name: rusted monastery key
23805.room_desc: A rusted iron key lies among the debris.

holy_unholy_system.description: Rooms in this zone can be consecrated or desecrated. Undead mobs receive modifiers based on room state.
holy_unholy_system.holy_water_effect: Temporarily changes a desecrated or neutral room to consecrated for 5 minutes.
